abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Agricultural Development
            Project for Barbados were as follows: In terms of
            sustainability, the project is likely to maintain the
            achievements generated as a result of policies arising from
            the sector study and adopted by Government. The Bank's
            performance is considered to be satisfactory overall. The
            Borrower's performance was also satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: flexibility during implementation
            resulted in a successful project, and should be built into
            all projects. Future loans should permit CBB to make on the
            spot adjustments to lending rates and project documentation
            requirements. Projects which involve more than one
            implementing agency require formal linkages to facilitate
            coordination. Ongoing promotion and monitoring of the credit
            line should be provided. Successful project implementation
            is dependent on the amount of human resources invested in
            management and coordination.
